channel.title: Saving files from the workstation to an external drive
channel.description:
Hello, I wasn't sure which forum to post this in.
Here's what I'm trying to do: I want to be able to save/download files directly from the workstation to an external drive plugged into my host. Ideally I'd like to be able to download directly from the Tor browser to the external drive. Someone mentioned to me about using shared folders, but I couldn't figure out how to do it.
Any suggestion? Is this even possible?

item.title: Saving files from the workstation to an external drive
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
David888:

Does using the shared folder impose any security issues?

See Security Risks of VirtualBox Shared Folders

David888:

I’m assuming I can’t save to the drive in live mode?

Wrong assumption. More description here:

Whonix – 16 Aug 20

Grub-live: Boot an existing Debian Host into Live Mode

Add a Live Mode entry to the grub boot menu on your existing Debian host platform. Stop Persistent Malware. Read-only mode. Make all writes go to non-persistent storage (RAM) instead of the hard disk.

item.title: Saving files from the workstation to an external drive
item.dc:creator: nodeguy
item.description:
David888:

Someone mentioned to me about using shared folders, but I couldn’t figure out how to do it.

I assume we’re talking VirtualBox and not KVM here.

With Workstation VM powered off:

VirtualBox > Settings > Shared Folders > Plus sign

Set to Auto-mount, but NOT Read-only.

Power on.

Look for /mnt/shared.
